prompt: Create Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 MDT configuration for hardware inventory/state: stream inventory entities and platform slot instance state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.196 port 57500. Sample every 10 minutes.
candidate:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group HARDWARE-INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-path inventory/entities
  sensor-path platform/slot/instance/state
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.196
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription COLLECT-HARDWARE-STATE
  sensor-group-id HARDWARE-INVENTORY-STATE sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !
expected:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INV-OPER
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state
 !
 subscription SUB-INV
  sensor-group-id INV-OPER sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-INV
 !
 destination-group DG-INV
  address-family ipv4 192.0.2.196 port 57500
   encoding self-describing-gpb
   protocol grpc no-tls
  !
 !
!
rationale: The candidate config correctly uses the specified IP (192.0.2.196), port (57500), transport (grpc no-tls), and encoding (self-describing-gpb). The sample interval is approximately 10 minutes (600000 ms). However, the sensor-paths differ from the reference: candidate uses 'inventory/entities' and 'platform/slot/instance/state' without the full YANG model prefixes and more detailed paths as in the reference. The sensor-paths are related but less specific, which is acceptable but not ideal. Naming and ordering differences are acceptable.
